text: Hajiya Maimuna Usman Adaji or Maimunat Adaji is a Nigerian politician. She was first elected to the House of Representatives in 2003. She was elected again in 2011 for the All Nigeria Peoples Party. == Life == She is an educationalist who owned a school who was a politician in the Fourth Nigerian Republic. She was first elected to the House of Representatives in 2003. In 2007 she was already a thirty-year veteran as a politician in Kwama. She is a member of the All Nigeria Peoples Party (ANPP) and she is still elected in an area which is generally a supporter of the People's Democratic Party (PDP) party. Adaji served as deputy chairperson of the Internal Affairs committee led by West Idahosa. In 2011 she was elected to the House of Representatives in 2011. Other women elected that year included Suleiman Oba Nimota, Folake Olunloyo, Martha Bodunrin, Betty Okogua-Apiafi, Rose Oko and Nkoyo Toyo. == References == Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Members of the House of Representatives (Nigeria) Category:Women members of the House of Representatives (Nigeria)
title: Maimunat Adaji
